column4: Guys, please help me. In Ubuntu my Rt2573 Wireless stick (RT2501) chipset works out of the box, in gentoo it doesnt. as opposed to ubuntu, dmesg does not report "rt73.bin" being loaded although i installed the according tools. What do I have to do to get it working?
everyone has issues with USB wireless adapters.
well on ubuntu it worked so I sposed id get it wokring on gentoo
This is an ubuntu forum. I haven't used Gentoo.
well im more generally asking what it TAKES to get it working - how ubuntu managed
Not sure. Ubuntu may have come with the drivers intalled. For instance, that adapter may use prism drivers.
What Linux drivers does it use?
Try '/join #gentoo.
thanks but im already in #gentoo
Have you tried using a windows driver with ndiswrapper?
not at all. the driver is there in the kernel
Are you asking what items are compiled into the kernel to get that specific driver working? Then you'll have to tell me which driver that adapter uses.
what is the definite way to find that out if im ubuntu ? lsmod?
The best way is to find out from the driver. Trying to find out what's going on in the kernel as it's running isnt easy.
how?
But the list of supported drivers using prism2_usb driver is to look up prism2_usb
i dont understand you
If you know how to program, check out prism2_usb.c
for what purpose? please make clear what you are refering to

You want to find out why Ubuntu runs it and not Gentoo. In order to know that, you'll need to know what Gentoo doesn't have that Ubuntu does. Ubuntu compiles it in, so the easiest way is to take that USB stick, and look up the specific driver using Google.
i can tell you what dmesg says upon plugging it in, it gives to warning about failing to allocate the device with rt2500 driver then loads rt73.bin and then it works - is this enough?!
rt73 driver is a mainline kernel since 2.6.24 So shouldn't gentoo have it?
